title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced for stealing checks from USPS boxes and committing bank fraud.
Rios-Franco sentenced to 35 months in prison; Baez sentenced to two years, with restitution totaling over $22,813.
From June 2023 to February 2024, checks were chemically altered and redeposited into accounts controlled by the offenders.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to 2026 State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained on his way to volleyball practice, targeted due to his father's immigration status, without a criminal record.
During detention, Gomes faced harsh conditions; his story highlights perceived issues in the U.S. immigration system.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman joked about speculation that rink colors affected visibility, saying his colorblindness rendered it irrelevant.
Despite Swayman's shaky performance, USA secured a win; he might not start again with two other goaltenders available.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from his Achilles injury, missing All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant, familiar with Achilles recovery, expects All-Star-level play from Tatum upon his return this season.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return makes the Celtics a playoff threat, even with him on limited minutes.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots have $41 million in cap space for the offseason to address key roster needs.
Patriots may target players like Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker, and Ravens TE Isaiah Likely.
Possible free agency additions aim to strengthen crucial positions: wide receiver, offensive tackle, and edge rusher.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered to make ESPN the new streaming home for MLB.TV.
Subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season, while non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free month trial.
MLB.TV accounts can be linked to ESPN for streaming; current MLB.TV subscribers automatically renew without requiring ESPN Unlimited.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Celtics' G League team, indicating a potential return from his Achilles injury.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, noting he looked like his usual self during practice.
Celtics President Brad Stevens stated Tatum will only return once he's fully ready; no official timetable set.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the top educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study, excelling in higher education attainment and public school performance.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, the highest in the U.S., with nearly 22% having advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in the rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card is up for auction, closing on February 21, with a current bid of $3.9 million.
The card has never been sold and remained with the Bernstein family, whose ties include a Taunton, Massachusetts silver plant.
Ken Goldin of Netflix’s 'King of Collectibles' discovered the card, describing it as the biggest hobby find in 50 years.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, 27, contributed to USA's 2025 IIHF World Championship win with a 5-0 record and a shutout.
Bruins' Charlie McAvoy teams up with fellow defenseman Quinn Hughes for Team USA's Olympic campaign.
